question: <image 1> What are the black areas in a chive disease characterized by orange and black pustules, where the orange pustules contain uredinia spores?
options: ['Another disease unrelated to the orange pustules', "Don't know and don't want to guess", 'Scale insects on the leaf', 'Another spore type of the same fungus', 'A parasite of the fungus growing on the spores']
description: The image shows three green chive stems with numerous small, raised pustules. The pustules are primarily orange but also have some black spots interspersed among them. The background appears to be a rough, textured surface, possibly soil or bark. The orange pustules are more prominent and cover a larger area of the stems, while the black spots are smaller and scattered.
